content:
• Monday, March 19, 2012
  • THRM

    Amerigon (ARGN) says it plans to offer shares of its common stock, no par value, in an...

    Amerigon (ARGN) says it plans to offer shares of its common stock, no par value, in an underwritten public offering. The offering is being made pursuant to a "shelf" registration statement filed on September 28, 2011. Shares -2.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:50 PM
  • RGP

    Regency Energy Partners (NYSE:RGP) -3.9% AH after announcing an 11M share stock offering, good...

    Regency Energy Partners (NYSE:RGP) -3.9% AH after announcing an 11M share stock offering, good for proceeds of $278.9M based on today's close. Regency plans to use the proceeds to repay borrowings made through a credit facility, and to redeem up to 35% of the principal owed on 9.375% senior notes due 2016. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:44 PM
  • FMCN

    More on Focus Media's (NASDAQ:FMCN) Q4: The company expects Q1 revenue of $190M-$194M and EPS of...

    More on Focus Media's (NASDAQ:FMCN) Q4: The company expects Q1 revenue of $190M-$194M and EPS of $0.43-$0.44, above a consensus of $183.5M and $0.39. The number of LCD screens in Focus' ad network rose 5% Q/Q to 155.7K, while the number of poster frames rose 5% Q/Q to 480.2K. $144.3M worth of shares were repurchased. No comment yet from Muddy Waters. FMCN +3.6% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM
  • BAC

    Bank of America (NYSE:BAC) +2.1% AH after issuing a denial that it has any plans to issue...

    Bank of America (NYSE:BAC) +2.1% AH after issuing a denial that it has any plans to issue shares, contrasting a market rumor that sent shares sliding late in the day. BofA did sell debt today, which the bank is likely to do as a way of financing activity, but a debt sale is far different than a share sale.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:12 PM | 2 Comments
  • FMCN

    Focus Media (NASDAQ:FMCN): Q4 EPS of $0.70 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $256M (+61% Y/Y) beats by...

    Focus Media (NASDAQ:FMCN): Q4 EPS of $0.70 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $256M (+61% Y/Y) beats by $31M. Shares +5.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:58 PM
  • BAC

    After hitting levels not seen since August thanks to a bullish Morgan Stanley note, Bank of...

    After hitting levels not seen since August thanks to a bullish Morgan Stanley note, Bank of America (BAC -2.8%) sold off into the close. Rumors about a new secondary offering appear to have been a culprit, though the Street's skepticism about the sustainability of BofA's recent rally may have made a selloff overdue.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:41 PM | 1 Comment
  • ADBE

    More on Adobe's (NASDAQ:ADBE) FQ1: Deferred revenue rose 3% Q/Q to $549M. The company expects...

    More on Adobe's (NASDAQ:ADBE) FQ1: Deferred revenue rose 3% Q/Q to $549M. The company expects FQ2 revenue of $1.09B-$1.14B and EPS of $0.57-$0.61, in-line with a consensus of $1.1B and $0.60. Taking into account its $400M acquisition of Efficient Frontier, Adobe expects FY12 revenue growth of 6%-8% and EPS of $2.38-$2.48, compared with a consensus of 4.7% growth and $2.42. Adobe, which was up 22% YTD, is down 4.4% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM
  • WMB

    More on Williams Partners/Caiman: Along with the acquisition, Williams Partners announces it...

    More on Williams Partners/Caiman: Along with the acquisition, Williams Partners announces it expects to increase cash distributions to unitholders by 8% in 2012, and 8%-10% annually in 2013 and 2014. It's now guiding for growth capex of $500M in 2012, and $590M in 2013. The deal is expected to close in Q2. Williams (NYSE:WMB), which owns 72% of Williams Partners, is up 1.4% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM
  • GMAN

    Gordmans Stores (NASDAQ:GMAN): Q4 EPS of $0.53 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $185M (+9.9% Y/Y)...

    Gordmans Stores (NASDAQ:GMAN): Q4 EPS of $0.53 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $185M (+9.9% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +6.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM
  • ADBE

    Adobe Systems (NASDAQ:ADBE): FQ1 EPS of $0.57 in-line. Revenue of $1.05B (+2% Y/Y) in-line....

    Adobe Systems (NASDAQ:ADBE): FQ1 EPS of $0.57 in-line. Revenue of $1.05B (+2% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -4.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM
  • X

    Steel stocks surge as UBS lifts target prices on U.S. Steel (X +6.4%), Steel Dynamics (STLD...

    Steel stocks surge as UBS lifts target prices on U.S. Steel (X +6.4%), Steel Dynamics (STLD +3.1%) and Nucor (NUE +1.3%). Several factors are driving gains in the sector despite recent profit warnings (I, II): a recent round of price hikes by steel producers that appear to be taking hold, rising U.S. car and truck sales, and declining costs. Also: AKS +4.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM
  • EXM

    Excel Maritime (EXM +6.7%) gains after Jefferies upped the shares to Hold earlier today, citing...

    Excel Maritime (EXM +6.7%) gains after Jefferies upped the shares to Hold earlier today, citing the company's debt restructuring.  The firm also raised its price target to $2 from $1.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM
  • SXC

    SunCoke Energy (SXC +7.3%) shares are raised to Conviction Buy from Neutral at Goldman Sachs,...

    SunCoke Energy (SXC +7.3%) shares are raised to Conviction Buy from Neutral at Goldman Sachs, which says SXC has a stable business in metallurgical coke used in steelmaking. Coal producer Patriot Coal (PCX +1.5%) is boosted to Neutral from Sell, Consol Energy (CNX +3.1%) is reiterated as a Buy, and Arch Coal (ACI -0.2%) is cut to Sell.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM
  • ABT

    Abbott Labs (ABT +1.4%) hits a three-year high as Deutsche Bank hikes its rating to Buy, arguing...

    Abbott Labs (ABT +1.4%) hits a three-year high as Deutsche Bank hikes its rating to Buy, arguing shares should climb ahead of the planned split of ABT’s drug unit from the rest of the company. Pharma could be worth $36/share by year-end 2012, the firm says, while the faster-growing medical products business could carry a value of $31/share.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:14 PM
  • UACL

    Universal Truckload Services (UACL +3%) gets a lift after its board approved a special $1 cash...

    Universal Truckload Services (UACL +3%) gets a lift after its board approved a special $1 cash dividend earlier today. The trucking service company doesn't have a regular dividend, and last gave a special payout in September 2011 at the same rate.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM
  • QCOM

    Qualcomm (QCOM +2.2%) shares surge to a 10-year high, a possible reaction to tear-down reports...

    Qualcomm (QCOM +2.2%) shares surge to a 10-year high, a possible reaction to tear-down reports indicating QCOM's growing position with hot new Apple products. Cowen adds ~$90M its to current-year revenue estimate because of the new iPad, and it expects the next iPhone also will use QCOM's chip products. A weekend Barron's article says shares could rise another 30% this year.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:03 PM
  • KSS

    A quick glance through Kohl's (KSS -2.5%) annual report shows the department store's commitment...

    A quick glance through Kohl's (KSS -2.5%) annual report shows the department store's commitment to have lower prices this year may come with some potential negatives. While aggressive in 2011 about passing higher costs along to customers, this year the compan says it will be "less aggressive," noting the change to have a positive impact on sales, but a negative impact on our gross margin rates.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:01 PM
  • BKNG

    Priceline (PCLN +3%) makes new highs after Mooness Crespi raises its PT to $800 from a prior...

    Priceline (PCLN +3%) makes new highs after Mooness Crespi raises its PT to $800 from a prior $700. Shares rose on Friday after Morgan Stanley raised its PT to $775 from $725, once more citing optimism regarding European market share gains.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:44 PM
  • BKS

    Barnes & Noble (BKS +3.1%) rallies following G Asset Management's offer to buy a 51% stake...

    Barnes & Noble (BKS +3.1%) rallies following G Asset Management's offer to buy a 51% stake in its college bookstore business. Meanwhile, the company states at a London Nook Developers Workshop it has no plans to open stores outside of the U.S., even as it markets the Nook overseas. In January, it was reported B&N is closing in on a partnership with U.K. bookstore chain Waterstones to sell the Nook.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:38 PM
  • KBH

    The NAHB's homebuilder sentiment for March may be a bad sign for California-based KB Home (KBH...

    The NAHB's homebuilder sentiment for March may be a bad sign for California-based KB Home (KBH -5.1%). The regional breakout for the West dropped 10 points after posting a 22 point gain the previous month.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:36 PM
  • RDSMY

    Kensey Nash (KNSY +24%) jumps after saying it's reached a settlement with St. Jude Medical (STJ...

    Kensey Nash (KNSY +24%) jumps after saying it's reached a settlement with St. Jude Medical (STJ -0.6%), resolving its dispute regarding vascular closure device licenses and related claims. Under the deal, St. Jude will pay Kensey $39 million over several quarters.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM
  • CRK

    Comstock Resources Inc. (CRK +4.7%) gives an update on its divestiture plans, saying it recently...

    Comstock Resources Inc. (CRK +4.7%) gives an update on its divestiture plans, saying it recently sold $37.7M of Stone Energy (SGY +4.33%) stock, and has raised $128M from property sales already for this year. The company says it plans to continue selling non-core oil and gas properties in its ongoing effort to redirect most of its drilling activity to unconventional oil prospects.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:55 PM
  • COF

    Capital One (COF +3%) gains on an upgrade to Buy on valuation at Jefferies, saying that downside...

    Capital One (COF +3%) gains on an upgrade to Buy on valuation at Jefferies, saying that downside risk has been removed due to recent equity raises. The firm ups its price target to $72 from $50.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:43 PM
  • EPAM

    EPAM Systems (EPAM +5.7%) surges after Barclays and UBS start coverage with bullish ratings....

    EPAM Systems (EPAM +5.7%) surges after Barclays and UBS start coverage with bullish ratings. Barclays likes EPAM's growth potential as an Eastern European IT outsourcing provider, and expects its differentiated offerings to drive share gains. EPAM's reliance on referrals to drive growth (as compared with direct sales) is seen as proof of the quality of its software development services. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:37 PM
  • ES-OLD

    EnergySolutions (ES-OLD +8.8%) pops after FBR Capital pounds the table on the stock, saying it...

    EnergySolutions (ES-OLD +8.8%) pops after FBR Capital pounds the table on the stock, saying it should be bought on the back of its stellar Q4 report and ahead of its investor meeting later this week.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:30 PM
  • SHLDQ

    Credit Suisse says Sears (SHLD -2.4%) will likely be forced to sell more of its valuable assets...

    Credit Suisse says Sears (SHLD -2.4%) will likely be forced to sell more of its valuable assets in 2013 in order to sustain its balance sheet. The firm expects the company to sell off its most valuable stores in the chain in order to survive. The firm rates the shares at Underperform rated with a $20 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:20 PM | 9 Comments
  • P

    Pandora (P +2.7%) is rallying, apparently on a rumor an unnamed investor will take a large...

    Pandora (P +2.7%) is rallying, apparently on a rumor an unnamed investor will take a large stake. The move comes even as Credit Suisse starts coverage at Neutral, expressing concerns about high content costs (forecast to be 60% of FY13 revenue) and low sell-through rates for premium mobile ads. Also of note is Pandora's announcement of several executive appointments for its ad unit, as it strives to improve monetization.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:13 PM
  • RGSE

    Real Good Solar (RSOL -2.6%) slides after being downgraded to Hold at Cantor earlier this...

    Real Good Solar (RSOL -2.6%) slides after being downgraded to Hold at Cantor earlier this morning, citing the company's substantially reduced 2012 guidance. The firm also lowers its price target to $2 from $5.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:19 PM
  • LVS

    Las Vegas Sands (LVS +4.1%) rises after announcing the Sands Cotai Central casino, which is...

    Las Vegas Sands (LVS +4.1%) rises after announcing the Sands Cotai Central casino, which is owned by its majority-held Sands China subsidiary, will open on April 11, and initially offer over 1,800 hotel rooms on Macau's Cotai Strip. Sands China claims to have invested over $8B in Macau thus far. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:15 PM
  • BMRN

    BioMarin (BMRN +2%) gains on an upgrade to Buy at Brean Murray based on increased confidence in...

    BioMarin (BMRN +2%) gains on an upgrade to Buy at Brean Murray based on increased confidence in the timing and outcome of its GALNS program to treat MPS IV. The firm believes the treatment could eventually exceed $500M in sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM
  • GPS

    Gap (GPS +1.8%) trades higher on an upgrade to Outperform at BMO Capital, citing the retailer's...

    Gap (GPS +1.8%) trades higher on an upgrade to Outperform at BMO Capital, citing the retailer's merchandising improvements, and an increased confidence in management's execution strategy.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM
  • AMPE

    Ampio Pharmaceuticals (AMPE +38.4%) says a preliminary assessment of a Phase II trial studying...

    Ampio Pharmaceuticals (AMPE +38.4%) says a preliminary assessment of a Phase II trial studying its Optina drug showed positive results, moving AMPE to conclude its study ahead of time. Optina aims to treat patients suffering from diabetic macular edema, an eye condition that can lead to blindness.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM
  • C

    Citigroup (C +3.5%) sells its entire 2.71% equity stake in Shanghai Pudong Bank, reaching an...

    Citigroup (C +3.5%) sells its entire 2.71% equity stake in Shanghai Pudong Bank, reaching an agreement that includes use of Citi’s global network and credit lines to support Pudong Bank’s international expansion. The sale will result in a $349M after-tax gain, and comes after Citi last week failed to meet minimum standards in bank stress tests.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM | 3 Comments
  • NAV

    Sterne Agee calls Navistar (NAV +2%) one of its Catalyst Driven Ideas, saying it expects the...

    Sterne Agee calls Navistar (NAV +2%) one of its Catalyst Driven Ideas, saying it expects the prospects for its EGR and LNG opportunities to become clearer this week during the Mid America Truck Show. The firm predicts that the stock could advance by 5% over the next two weeks and it maintains a Buy rating.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM
  • SOL

    ReneSola (SOL -1.7%) dips after being downgraded to Underperform on valuation this morning at...

    ReneSola (SOL -1.7%) dips after being downgraded to Underperform on valuation this morning at Macquarie, citing an overly competitive environment that is putting pressure on margins.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:03 AM
  • UNTD

    United Online (UNTD +2.7%) catches a bid after its NetZero unit introduces a cheap 4G broadband...

    United Online (UNTD +2.7%) catches a bid after its NetZero unit introduces a cheap 4G broadband service in partnership with Clearwire (CLWR). The service, which will be available in over 80 U.S. cities, includes a free plan that provides 200MB of monthly data, a $10/month basic plan featuring 500MB of data, and a $35/month Pro plan featuring 2GB of data.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM
  • BAC

    Bank of America (BAC +2.6%), whose shares have now more than doubled from their Dec. 19 low,...

    Bank of America (BAC +2.6%), whose shares have now more than doubled from their Dec. 19 low, continues to power higher amid positive comments from Morgan Stanley. The firm raises earnings estimates and price targets for BofA, as well as C +3.3%, GS +1.5% and JPM +0.8%, citing stronger consumer credit among the reasons.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM
  • ETFC

    E-Trade (ETFC +3.6%) gets a boost from a Wells Fargo upgrade to Outperform this morning, citing...

    E-Trade (ETFC +3.6%) gets a boost from a Wells Fargo upgrade to Outperform this morning, citing improved retail investor engagement, better housing fundamentals, and slowing fund outflows.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM
  • UPS

    UPS is now up 2.7% after reaching a deal to acquire TNT Express at a modest premium to its...

    UPS is now up 2.7% after reaching a deal to acquire TNT Express at a modest premium to its original bid. Helping is an upgrade to Overweight from JPMorgan, which expects the deal to provide a major EPS boost in 2013 and 2014. The deal is expected to result in UPS obtaining 36% of its revenue from outside the U.S., up from 26% today. However, analysts caution asset sales may be needed to win regulatory approval.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM
  • AVGO

    Chipmaker Broadcom (BRCM +1.9%) says it won a permanent injunction against certain products of...

    Chipmaker Broadcom (BRCM +1.9%) says it won a permanent injunction against certain products of Emulex (NYSE:ELX) previously found to infringe two BRCM patents. The permanent injunction will prohibit Emulex from importing, manufacturing, using and selling the enjoined products in the U.S. and from assisting others in doing the same.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:19 AM
  • DVN

    Devon Energy (DVN +1.3%) is upgraded to Buy from Hold with a $91 price target raised from $81 by...

    Devon Energy (DVN +1.3%) is upgraded to Buy from Hold with a $91 price target raised from $81 by Goldman Sachs, which feels shares may be ready to break out after several years of underperformance: "DVN is very actively testing new exploration plays in the U.S./Canada, and we believe success can lead to a re-rating of the stock as investors re-evaluate resource/longer-term growth potential."

     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM
  • CORV

    Shares of Cardiome Pharma (CRME -43%) plunge after announcing Merck (NYSE:MRK) will stop...

    Shares of Cardiome Pharma (CRME -43%) plunge after announcing Merck (NYSE:MRK) will stop development of its oral vernakalant, which was being evaluated as maintenance therapy for the long-term prevention of atrial fibrillation recurrence.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:45 AM
  • MTEM

    JMP Securities says the recent clinical data and enrollment progress of Threshold...

    JMP Securities says the recent clinical data and enrollment progress of Threshold Pharmaceuticals' (THLD) TH-302 treatment for soft tissue sarcoma has increased its confidence in the drug's likelihood of success and commercial potential; the firm raises its stock price target to $12 from $7. THLD +7% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM
  • AAPL

    Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) says on its conference call (webcast, live blog) it can finance its planned...

    Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) says on its conference call (webcast, live blog) it can finance its planned dividend and buybacks without having to repatriate foreign cash. Nonetheless, the company says it says it plans to keep a healthy amount of domestic cash (currently around $30B) on hand for investment opportunities. Apple will "periodically" review its dividend payout. Shares +1.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:28 AM | 3 Comments
  • ARCH

    Arch Coal (NYSE:ACI) is cut to Sell from Neutral with a reduced price target of $10 from $14 at...

    Arch Coal (NYSE:ACI) is cut to Sell from Neutral with a reduced price target of $10 from $14 at Goldman Sachs, which says some of ACI's key coal holdings remain unpriced in a market where demand is falling, and that it also compares unfavorably to its rivals on its earnings growth relative to is valuation. ACI -2.7% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:24 AM | 1 Comment

  • Market preview: It's all about Apple following the dividend and buyback goodies it's unveiled...

    Market preview: It's all about Apple following the dividend and buyback goodies it's unveiled for investors. The stock is seesawing a bit and is now +1.5%, although it's not enough to pull U.S. futures out the red, and the S&P benchmark is -0.2%. UPS is +1% after it finally snags TNT for $6.8B, while AboveNet is +13.8% as it agrees to be bought by Zayo for ~$2.2B. Later: NAHB Housing Market Index
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • AAPL

    Quick take on Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) announcement: The dividend results in an annual yield of...

    Quick take on Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) announcement: The dividend results in an annual yield of 1.8%. Based on a consensus FY12 EPS estimate of $43.13 (likely conservative), the dividend provides a conservative payout ratio of 25%. In FQ1, Apple saw its diluted share count increase by 8.4M shares Y/Y. Neutralizing the impact of such a dilution rate at current prices would require ~$4.9B worth of annual buybacks. AAPL +1.5%. (PR) (webcast) (live blog)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:11 AM | 1 Comment
  • ABVT

    Premarket gainers: ABVT +14%. DYN +10%. THLD +6%. NBG +6%. PWRD +4%.Losers: S -5%. IRE -4%. FRO...

    Premarket gainers: ABVT +14%. DYN +10%. THLD +6%. NBG +6%. PWRD +4%.
    Losers: S -5%. IRE -4%. FRO -3%. AIXG -3%. ACI -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:05 AM
  • AAPL

    Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) has reopened for premarket trade following the dividend announcement. Shares...

    Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) has reopened for premarket trade following the dividend announcement. Shares have given up earlier gains in the 3% range, now -0.9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:52 AM | 1 Comment
  • S

    Sprint (NYSE:S) -4.5% premarket after shares are downgraded to Underperform from Market Perform...

    Sprint (NYSE:S) -4.5% premarket after shares are downgraded to Underperform from Market Perform at Bernstein, which believes the next generation LTE iPhone will be badly disadvantaged on Sprint's network, thus impacting sales. The risks of bankruptcy for Sprint are rising, the firm says while not actually predicting this will occur. The stock price target is cut to $1.75 from $2.50.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:46 AM | 7 Comments
  • ADGF

    Adams Golf (NASDAQ:ADGF) +9% premarket after agreeing to be bought by a subsidiary of sportswear...

    Adams Golf (NASDAQ:ADGF) +9% premarket after agreeing to be bought by a subsidiary of sportswear and equipment maker Adidas for $10.80/share in cash, or $70M total.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:29 AM
  • ABVT

    AboveNet (NYSE:ABVT) +13.5% premarket after agreeing to be bought by Zayo Group for ~$2.2B. Zayo...

    AboveNet (NYSE:ABVT) +13.5% premarket after agreeing to be bought by Zayo Group for ~$2.2B. Zayo will pay $84.00/share in cash for ABVT, a 13% premium over last Friday's closing price. As part of the deal, GTCR, a Chicago-based P-E firm, will make an equity investment in Zayo. 

     
     
     
     
    | 8:18 AM
  • AAPL

    Wedbush ups its price target for Apple (AAPL +2.8%) to $750 from $585, believing the shares...

    Wedbush ups its price target for Apple (AAPL +2.8%) to $750 from $585, believing the shares remain reasonably valued. The company also raised its FQ2 iPad sales estimate to 12.7M units from 11.6M, and says it expects an integrated Apple TV in late summer and the new iPhone introduction this fall to be the biggest upgrade cycle yet.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:41 AM

  • EU stocks follow some of their Asian peers lower as they consolidate last weeks gains. London...

    EU stocks follow some of their Asian peers lower as they consolidate last weeks gains. London -0.5%, Paris -0.8%, Frankfurt -0.7%, Madrid -0.1%, Milan -0.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:59 AM

  • Asian shares are mixed and waiting for a catalyst following disappointing U.S. consumer...

    Asian shares are mixed and waiting for a catalyst following disappointing U.S. consumer sentiment and industrial output data on Friday. Japan +0.1% to 10142, Hong Kong -0.9% to 21115, China +0.2% to 2410, India -1.2% to 17466.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 AM
